org.openimaj.aop.classloader

Class ClassLoaderTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.aop.classloader.ClassLoaderTransform

  • public class ClassLoaderTransform
extends Object
    ClassLoaderTransform provides an alternative to using a java agent to perform byte-code manipulation by providing a classloader that will automatically transform classes as they are loaded.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public static javassist.Loader run(javassist.ClassPool pool,
                                   MultiTransformClassFileTransformer tf,
                                   File jarFile,
                                   String[] args)
                            throws Throwable
        Run the main method of the given jar file, passing all classes as they are loaded through the transformer to modify the bytecode. The main method must be specified by the "Main-Class" manifest entry.
        Parameters:
        pool - the classpool to hold classes as they are loaded
        tf - the transform(s) to apply
        jarFile - the jar file to run
        args - the arguments to pass to the main method
        Returns:
        the classloader used for loading the classes in the jar file
        Throws:
        Throwable - if an error occurs

      • getMainClass

        public static String getMainClass(File jarFile)
                           throws IOException
        Get the main class from the manifest of the given jar file
        Parameters:
        jarFile - the jar file
        Returns:
        the main class or null if not found
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs when reading

      • run

        public static javassist.Loader run(javassist.ClassPool pool,
                                   MultiTransformClassFileTransformer tf,
                                   String classpath,
                                   String mainClass,
                                   String[] args)
                            throws Throwable
        Run the main method of the given class, transforming any classes found on the given classpath as they are loaded.
        Parameters:
        pool - the classpool to hold classes as they are loaded
        tf - the transform(s) to apply
        classpath - the classpath on which to search for classes
        mainClass - the main class with the main(String[]) method
        args - the arguments to pass to the main method
        Returns:
        the classloader used for loading the classes in the jar file
        Throws:
        Throwable - if an error occurs

                       Class<?> clz,

        Re-load the given class in a newly created Loader that is configured to apply the given transform(s), and then run the main method.
        Parameters:

        clz - the class
        args - the arguments
        Throws:

      • run

        public static boolean run(Class<?> clz,
                          String[] args,
                          ClassTransformer transformer,
                          ClassTransformer... transformers)
                   throws Throwable
        If the the given class has not already been loaded in by Loader, load it in a newly created Loader that is configured to apply the given transform(s), run the main method and return true. If the class's classload is a Loader then return false.
        Parameters:
        clz - the class to load, transform and run
        args - the arguments to the main method
        transformer - the first transformer
        transformers - any additional transformers
        Returns:
        true if the class has been reloaded; false otherwise
        Throws:
        Throwable - if an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Throwable
        Main method for an alternative in-place loading strategy. Allows a self-contained program jar to automatically run ClassTransformers on itself.

        Modify the assembled jar file so that the Main-Class is set as this class (org.openimaj.aop.classloader.ClassLoaderTransform) and add additional keys to the manifest to point at the actual class main ( MAIN_CLASS) and the transformer classes (TRANSFORMERS, separated by TRANSFORMERS_SEPARATOR).

        The specified transformer classes must all be instances of ClassTransformer and also have a no-args constructor.

        Parameters:
        args - the arguments to pass to the program being run
        Throws:
        Throwable - if an error occurs
